May God bless their families, and may our community come together to offer them support in this trying time.
I ask that in Orange County, and across our nation, we think of the lives lost - in neighborhood basketball courts, school gyms, NBA arenas, and wherever the game is played.

All of us wish they could play another game. 

Orange County is grieving, but we will find solace and purpose in the example they left behind and the belief in something bigger than ourselves.

Our community lost kids who were overflowing with promise. Kids who were great competitors and even better friends. Kids you could count on - on and off the court. Kids who pushed themselves to be more and were the best daughters that any parent could ask for.
The parents we lost knew all too well the early morning wake-ups, sweaty car rides, and late nights in a gym were worth the lessons they instilled in their children - teamwork, dedication, faith.

Remember their names. 

Alyssa, Keri + John Altobelli 
Gianna + Kobe Bryant
Payton + Sarah Chester
Christina Mauser
Ara Zobayan

They were all connected by a love of the game. A steadfast belief in sports being bigger than a score - more than just an hour or two on the court.
